page.title: 13ECOLOGY, WOODLANDS
page.content: South of Heol Senni the steep western side of the valley is covered with patches of deciduous scrub interspersed with areas of bracken. Gazing by sheep prevents any regenerat -ion of trees. Maps dating from the late nineteenth century show that the whole of the steep face of Fan Frynych was wooded at that time. This was felled during World War I. A few residual clumps of European Larch and other conifers indicate that these can flourish as high as 550 metres despite exposure to the prevailing winds. Below this slope there is a small Forestry Commission plantation of conifers which dates from the nineteen fifties.
